Package org.springframework.web.servlet

Class NoHandlerFoundException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
jakarta.servlet.ServletException
org.springframework.web.servlet.NoHandlerFoundException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, ErrorResponse
public class NoHandlerFoundException extends ServletException implements ErrorResponse
By default, when the DispatcherServlet can't find a handler for a request it sends a 404 response. However, if its property "throwExceptionIfNoHandlerFound" is set to true this exception is raised and may be handled with a configured HandlerExceptionResolver.
Since:
4.0
Author:
Brian Clozel
See Also:
  • DispatcherServlet.setThrowExceptionIfNoHandlerFound(boolean)
  • DispatcherServlet.noHandlerFound(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)
